title: iRobot Is Testing Key Support and the Outcome Doesn't Look Bullish
text:
During Tuesday night's Mad Money Lightning Round, Jim Cramer was bearish on iRobot Corp. (IRBT) .

In this daily bar chart of IRBT, below, we can see a small double top pattern in March and April of last year followed by a steep decline that has more than cut prices in half. IRBT is below the declining 50-day moving average line and the falling 200-day line.

The On-Balance-Volume (OBV) line has declined sharply from late April and tells us that sellers of IRBT have been very aggressive.

The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) oscillator is in a sell mode below the zero line.

In this weekly bar chart of IRBT, below, we can see that prices are testing a key support area from 2017-2018 in the $60-$57 area. A break of this key level is likely to precipitate further declines.

Prices are below the declining 40-week moving average line.

The weekly OBV line is bearish and so is the MACD oscillator.

In this Point and Figure chart of IRBT, below, we can see a possible downside price target of $49.

Bottom line strategy: All of our charts and indicators of IRBT are bearish. Stand aside and keep your powder dry.
description: Let's check out the charts and indicators of the maker of the Roomba....IRBT
authors: Indicators Of The Maker Of The Roomba.
